items.text: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
items.plainText: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.

items.text: The heavens declare the glory of God; and the firmament sheweth his handywork.
items.plainText: The heavens declare the glory of God; and the firmament sheweth his handywork.

items.text: Day unto day uttereth speech, and night unto night sheweth knowledge.
items.plainText: Day unto day uttereth speech, and night unto night sheweth knowledge.

items.text: There is no speech nor language, where their voice is not heard.
items.plainText: There is no speech nor language, where their voice is not heard.

items.text: Their line is gone out through all the earth, and their words to the end of the world. In them hath he set a tabernacle for the sun,
items.plainText: Their line is gone out through all the earth, and their words to the end of the world. In them hath he set a tabernacle for the sun,

items.text: Which is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber, and rejoiceth as a strong man to run a race.
items.plainText: Which is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber, and rejoiceth as a strong man to run a race.

items.text: His going forth is from the end of the heaven, and his circuit unto the ends of it: and there is nothing hid from the heat thereof.
items.plainText: His going forth is from the end of the heaven, and his circuit unto the ends of it: and there is nothing hid from the heat thereof.

items.text: The law of the LORD is perfect, converting the soul: the testimony of the LORD is sure, making wise the simple.
items.plainText: The law of the LORD is perfect, converting the soul: the testimony of the LORD is sure, making wise the simple.

items.text: The statutes of the LORD are right, rejoicing the heart: the commandment of the LORD is pure, enlightening the eyes.
items.plainText: The statutes of the LORD are right, rejoicing the heart: the commandment of the LORD is pure, enlightening the eyes.

items.text: The fear of the LORD is clean, enduring for ever: the judgments of the LORD are true and righteous altogether.
items.plainText: The fear of the LORD is clean, enduring for ever: the judgments of the LORD are true and righteous altogether.

items.text: More to be desired are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold: sweeter also than honey and the honeycomb.
items.plainText: More to be desired are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold: sweeter also than honey and the honeycomb.

items.text: Moreover by them is thy servant warned: and in keeping of them there is great reward.
items.plainText: Moreover by them is thy servant warned: and in keeping of them there is great reward.

items.text: Who can understand his errors? cleanse thou me from secret faults.
items.plainText: Who can understand his errors? cleanse thou me from secret faults.

items.text: Keep back thy servant also from presumptuous sins; let them not have dominion over me: then shall I be upright, and I shall be innocent from the great transgression.
items.plainText: Keep back thy servant also from presumptuous sins; let them not have dominion over me: then shall I be upright, and I shall be innocent from the great transgression.

items.text: Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O LORD, my strength, and my redeemer.
items.plainText: Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O LORD, my strength, and my redeemer.
